command: dism /Mount-Image /ImageFile:C:\images\install_clean.wim /Index:1 /MountDir:C:\Mount\Base; dism /Mount-Image /ImageFile:C:\images\install_mod.wim /Index:1 /MountDir:C:\Mount\Win; Copy-Item -Path C:\staging\maldrv.sys -Destination C:\Mount\Win\Windows\System32\drivers\maldrv.sys -Force; $b=(Get-FileHash C:\Mount\Base\Windows\System32\drivers\maldrv.sys -Algorithm SHA256 -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue).Hash; $m=(Get-FileHash C:\Mount\Win\Windows\System32\drivers\maldrv.sys -Algorithm SHA256 -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue).Hash; Compare-Object @($b) @($m)
explanation: Injects a driver into the offline system image and compares SHA256 hashes versus the clean baseline to validate the unauthorized addition.
rationale_steps: Mount both baseline and target images with DISM (requires Administrator).
Copy a driver into the modified image's drivers directory.
Compute and Compare-Object the file hashes to confirm divergence.
